Introduction to module LinProc¶

Some functions relevant for generating vector linear processes

\(dX_t = B X_t + \beta + \sigma d W_t\)

where b is a stable matrix and beta a vector, and conditional vector linear processes (Ornstein–Uhlenbeck bridges so to say) ending at time T in point v,

\(dX^\star_t = B X_t + \beta + a r(s, X^\star_t) + \sigma d W_t\)

where \(r(t,x) = \operatorname{grad}_x \log p(t,x; T, v)\) and p is the transition density of X.

The parameter lambda is the solution to the Lyapunov equation B'lambda + lambda B = -sigma, see module Lyap,

lambda = lyap(b, -a)

Reference¶

LinProc.K(h, lambda, b)¶

Covariance matrix \(Cov(X_{t}, X_{t + h})\)

LinProc.r(h, x, v, b, beta, lambda)¶

Returns \(r(t,x) = \operatorname{grad}_x \log p(t,x; T, v)\) where p is the transition density of the linear process, used by Bstar.

LinProc.Bstar(T, v, b, beta, a, lambda)¶

Returns the drift function of a vector linear process bridge which end at time T in point v.
